intro: Ficus ypsilophlebia, commonly known as the Ypsilophlebia fig, is a species of flowering plant in the family Moraceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Thailand and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are usually dark green and glossy. It produces small, clustered fruits that are typically green when unripe and turn yellow when mature. Ficus ypsilophlebia is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and relatively easy care requirements.
